column3: See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#refactoring\nIMO it's a distracting PR with no benefits.
Please squash your commits, and amend the commit message as per the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

I appreciate that you're trying to contribute, and have nothing against this change in itself, however please don't submit PRs that just change words around. If you are looking for something worthwhile to address you could look at the open issues, for example the list of [good first issues](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22good+first+issue%
@laanwj However minuscule, this is a user facing string with ~~a bug~~ spelling error in it. Was trying to find out what the process is, for fixing some of the more unclear strings later.
I wouldn't say bug, nothing is broken.

Don't use the word 'bug' like that, please. It's certainly possible to have a bug in a text message or documentation when it explains things wrong, and sometimes those are serious bugs that can result in coin loss.\nHowever, this is not one of such.\nYou're welcome to improve messages if they're unclear, though!

@laanqj My apologies. Adjusting for clarity in strings other than this leaves a whole lot less room for misunderstandings, making for fewer errors in translation. I don't know what there is to be avoided, but I found some strings where the certainty of the outcome could be narrowed down quite a bit.
@comradekingu No need to apologise.\n\nTend to NACK, as this will invalidate all existing translations and we'd have to manually (or by script) fix them up on transifex. Imo, not worth it.
Please drop unicode from PR title and commit message.
Don't modify this file, it is "Automatically generated by extract_strings_qt.py".
